results.title: Single-dose local intraosseous injection of simvastatin suppresses breast cancer with tumor vascular normalization
results.text_hl: Our previous studies found that a single-dose local intraosseous @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ injection rapidly and long-termly mobilized bone marrow-derived endothelial progenitor cells to peripheral blood, promoting angiogenesis and ameliorating @<m>DISEASE_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia injury@@@.

results.title: Single Intraosseous Simvastatin Application Induces Endothelial Progenitor Cell Mobilization and Therapeutic Angiogenesis in a Diabetic Hindlimb Ischemia Rat Model.
results.text_hl: In this study, the authors tested whether intraosseous delivery of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ could mobilize endothelial progenitor cells and enhance recovery in a @<m>DISEASE_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@hindlimb ischemia@@@ model.

results.title: Imaging the Proangiogenic Effects of Cardiovascular Drugs in a Diabetic Model of Limb Ischemia
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, a widely used antidiabetic drug for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, a 3-hydroxy-3-methyl-glutaryl-CoA (HMG-CoA) reductase inhibitor, used to regulate @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ levels, have previously been shown to enhance recovery from @DISEASE_Acute_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000208 @@@acute@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@limb ischemia@@@ in nondiabetic animals, and pretreatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has been shown to ameliorate @<m>DISEASE_Ischemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@limb ischemia@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Goggi JL, Haslop A, Boominathan R, Chan K, Soh V, Cheng P, Robins EG, Bhakoo KK. Imaging the Proangiogenic Effects of Cardiovascular Drugs in a Diabetic Model of Limb Ischemia Contrast Media Mol Imaging. 2019;2019():2538909. PMID: 30863219
citations.BibTeX: @article{30863219, title={Imaging the Proangiogenic Effects of Cardiovascular Drugs in a Diabetic Model of Limb Ischemia}, author={Goggi JL and Haslop A and Boominathan R and Chan K and Soh V and Cheng P and Robins EG and Bhakoo KK}, journal={Contrast Media Mol Imaging}, volume={2019}, pages={2538909}}
